forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind 14 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 13 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

weather_report:
Tonight in Downtown San Francisco, a cloak of cloudiness envelops the city, hinting at the cooler embrace of summer’s arrival. With temperatures dipping into the low fifties, there’s a briskness in the air, invigorated by a west-southwest wind that whispers through the streets at a steady pace. The gusts, playful yet firm, remind us of the coastal energy just beyond the urban sprawl. Stars remain shy behind the clouds, and a mild marine layer wraps around the Golden Gate, providing a soft filter over the iconic landmark while the city glows beneath it.

As dawn breaks into Sunday, the clouds will gradually yield to the sun, bringing a gentle warmth as the day unfolds. The high will flirt with the sixties, though expect a gradual shift into the cooler afternoon as the sun plays hide and seek. A light breeze will accompany the sunshine, an invitation to step outdoors. As you consider attire for the day, layers remain your best friend; a light jacket will seamlessly complement your morning coffee ritual and can be shed as the sun takes its place high in the sky. With such enticing weather, perhaps a stroll through Golden Gate Park or a visit to the local farmer’s market is in order, allowing one to savor the flavors and sights that define this vibrant city.
